alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN SWITZERLAND AND CARROLL COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Madison, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Vevay, Ghent, Worthville, Prestonville, Brooksburg, Braytown, Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 40, Interstate 71 at State Route 227, Langstaff, Locust, English, Easterday, General Butler State Park and Mount Sterling. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
